title: There's a very significant nerf to thresh on PBE that I don't think anyone's noticed.
body:
>_**Edit - Check out the brilliant video, [There's a very significant BUFF to Thresh on PBE that I don't think anyone's noticed](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7nzRNdUl43g) Zeepy made in reply to this, and my reply to that; [There's a slightly significant nerf to Janna on PBE that I don't think anyone's noticed.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/mAdcqkim-theres-a-slightly-significant-nerf-to-janna-on-pbe-that-i-dont-think-anyones-noticed)**_

Last whisper now only works against bonus Armor, not base, and was made cheaper (only 1300 gold) with powerful upgrades to compensate.

However, unlike everyone else, Thresh doesn't get base armor added per level, but rather gets **_bonus_** armor added for every soul he takes.

This effectively makes Last whisper and its upgrades far more effective against him than anyone else.

Lets compare live Last Whisper with its contemporary partner on PBE - Lord Domik's Regards. Both give 40 AD, and effectively cost the same (LDR cost more, but gold income is up about an equal amount), so we can ignore that in our comparison. However, LDR also gives 1.5% damage amplification per 50 hp the target has over you, capping at 15% at 500 hp. Thresh gets that on the new Sight Stone + Targons combo alone.

Assuming Thresh has 90 armor, 16 of which is base, live Last Whisper results in at 90 x .65 = 58.5 effective armor, or 36.9% damage reduction

With LDR, it is 16 + (74 x .6) = 60.4 effective armor, or 37.7% damage reduction; however, the damage is amplified by 15%, for (1 - (1 - .377) x 1.15) = 28.3% damage reduction. 

LDR ends up doing (1 - .283) / (1 - .369) = 13.6% increased damage against Thresh vs the Last Whisper on live.

For comparison, lets look at Blitz. Lets say he's level 12 for a base AD 63.8, with a glacial shroud (20 armor) and 9 flat armor from his glyphs armor from runes, for a total of 92.8 armor.

Live Last Whisper results in at 92.8 x .65 = 60.3 effective armor, or 37.6% damage reduction

With LDR, it is 63.8 + (29 x .6) = 81.2 effective armor, or 55.2% damage reduction; however, the damage is amplified by 15%, for (1 - (1 - .552) x 1.15) = 48.5% damage reduction. 

LDR ends up doing (1 - .485) / (1 - .376) = 17.5 % LESS damage than of LW on live.

All this second example really shows is that LW on live is a a great damage multiplier, regardless of if your opponent built armor, while the LDR is only useful if your opponent is stacking armor _**or is Thresh.**_

Let's say I am a level 18 Vi with 200 Armor, 85 of which is base. Live Last Whisper reduces her Armor to 130 or 56.5% damage reduction (meaning she takes 43.5% of the damage).

Lord Dominik's Regards, penetrates 40% of her armor, giving her 154 armor or 60.6% damage reduction. But that's not including 15% damage amp, so it ends up doing (1 - 0.606)1.15 = 45.2% of the damage to her. Thus it ends up doing about 100*(45.2/43.2) = 104% more damage to her.

For comparison, a 200 armor Thresh takes 13.2% increased damage. Dividing 1.132/1.04, we see Thresh takes 8% more damage relative to Vi.

Edit: For clarity and to show my work a bit more.

Your math is horribly wrong, you know that, right? The 15% amp is to the ADC's damage prior to armor being put in, so if an ADC were to do 100 before armor and 40 after it, with the 15%, they'd do 115 before, and 46 after it. The armor affects all physical damage amps so in reality, that 15% just turned into 6% after armor. 

But really. ADC's before would have the 6% from masteries and the 35% from LW, which would equate to about 39%. ArP now won't be scaling multiplicative, so the new 7% and the 40% from Lord Dominik's show as additive, as you'll see in game when it's released or you can see it on the PBE like rest of us. So you can get 47% now of BONUS armor.

Now to the actual numbers. That's 115 armor being reduced by 47%. So she'll be left with about 61 armor, totaling 146. Old LW would do about 40% of ALL armor. Which would be a loss of 80, bringing her down to 120. 146 is about 59.3% physical reduction where as 120 is about 54.5% The difference is very subtle at best. 

Now for Thresh with 200 armor, he only has a base of 16. Old LW would bring him down to around 120. New LW brings him down to 97ish armor. 97 armor is a little under 50% where as 120 is about 54.5%. 

He takes more damage now, obviously, but I'd be less scared of the ADC's with the new LW against poorly ol' Thresh 'cause if he doesn't build armor items early, a quick 1.3k LW for 30% and a Ghostblade for +20 at about 20 minutes in when Thresh only has about 100 souls for 75 bonus armor, he'll get shredded down to only a bonus of 22, meaning he'd be at 38. IF you get 19 from runes, that's dropping him to 19. If you want to add in the mastery for another 5ish around then, that's about 14 armor. He just went from nearly 50% reduction to 12%. lol. That's where Thresh is hit. His mid game pre-big armor items. After armor items, he's fine, but if that Talon or Zed mid see him sitting down at bot lane without an armor item yet? He'll dead quicker than an AP Sona being caught by a Faker Ahri with DFG.

Your math is horribly wrong, you know that, right? There is something called the Commutativity of Multiplication that says for all real numbers a and b, a*b = b*a. Now I won't give you too much grief if you can't recite it properly, but it's one of 10 Axiom's of Mathematics, so even if you don't know it, you know it. It means that (100*0.4)*1.15 = 1.15*(100*0.4) = 46. Furthermore, to calculate the increase afterwards, we do 100*(46 - 40)/40 = 15%. Amazing, a 15% increase in damage results in a 15% increase of damage, not 6%.

> But really. ADC's before would have the 6% from masteries and the 35% from LW, which would equate to about 39%. ArP now won't be scaling multiplicative, so the new 7% and the 40% from Lord Dominik's show as additive, as you'll see in game when it's released or you can see it on the PBE like rest of us. So you can get 47% now of BONUS armor.

Ok, I didn't look at mid-game (I kind of doubt that Last Whisper will be one of the first 2 items in most cases). Let's change that. Say Vi and Thresh are both level 11 with 100 Armor and that there are no other sources of penetration, and everything else is constant. A level 11 Vi will have 61 base armor and 39 bonus. A Last Whisper reduces this to 65 Armor, or a 39.3% damage reduction. With new last whisper, Vi now will have 84.3 armor, for 45.7% damage reduction. Factoring the LDR damage in, Vi will take 98.9% of the damage she currently does. Thresh on the other hand will have 66.4 Armor, for 39.9% damage reduction, thus taking 113% of the damage he currently does. That's about a 14.6% relative increase over Vi.

Of course, this doesn't look at how often people will buy last whisper mid game. Unless you are under very specific circumstances, I doubt it will happen. Even now, you don't typically see last whisper until a 3rd or 4th item. I don't think we will see the new Last Whisper all that often before the second item.
